ygData.subject: RE: Brad On Binding (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... so ... This sounds right. I started playing/exploring the Internet in April. At THAT point, some zones were labeled as dungeons and a note was there that
ygData.messageBody:
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, December 29, 1999 10:59 AM

>Am I interpreting his last statement correctly? The way I read it, casters
>being able to bind in a dungeon zone is a bug. That would seem to indicate
>that Verant's original intent was that casters could only bind in
>cities and outdoor zones. I've never heard that discussed anywhere before
so
>that lead to my confusion on his statement.

This sounds right.
I started playing/exploring the Internet in April. At THAT point, some zones
were labeled as dungeons and a note was there that you could not bind there.
I guess it never pinged on me "duh. That's what casters are doing on those
Vox raids, etc" since I have never gotten high enough to really do a lot in
dungeons (I'm somewhat afraid of them) For myself, those of my characters
that can bind do NOT do it in a dungeon. They do it near a zoneline that
does not get a lot of
trains (and usually up a wall somewhere)

Sarah Heacock
